WorkItem.ClosedComment: Closing this issue as issue is resolved in 3rd party plugin
WorkItem.Description:
Emacs said "invalid-function: declare-function" when I load TypeScript.el.
My Emacs version is GNU Emacs 24.2.1.

I patched like this:

56c56
< (declare-function ido-mode "ido")
---
> (declare-function ido-mode "ido" ())

now I have no error with TypeScript.el.
WorkItem.Summary: TypeScript support for Emacs is broken

Comments.Message: sorry. this issue is possibly not match to this issue tracker....

Hi,

We just upload a new version of the TypeScript.el file http://blogs.msdn.com/b/interoperability/archive/2012/10/01/sublime-text-vi-emacs-typescript-enabled.aspx
Let us know if it now is backwards compatible.

We are working on making the bits available to the community in a better more practical way than just a zip download. Stay tuned for that and keep the feedback coming!

- Olivier
